intro: Streptocarpus confusus subsp. confusus, commonly known as the African violet, is a species native to eastern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate light conditions. Streptocarpus confusus subsp. confusus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
